tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Next 25 Money Winners from 2014 Web.com Tour Finals
tourBios.curYearHigh: Finished T4 at the Sanderson Farms Championship after holding the first- and second-round leads, highlighted by a course-record 10-under 62 at the CC of Jackson. Held a four-shot lead after 36 holes before a lengthy weather delay resulted in a Monday finish.
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Made the cut in 11 of 27 PGA TOUR starts, collecting five top-25 finishes and finishing No. 135 in the FedExCup standings. Made a solid bid at the Wyndham Championship to climb within the top 125 in the FedExCup standings and/or official money list, but a T18 showing at Sedgefield CC yielded the 135th-place finish in the FedExCup standings...Entered the Wells Fargo Championship in early May having missed the cut in his previous three starts on TOUR (and five out of his last seven), but rounds of 71-70-69-70 led to a T8 finish (his first top-10 since a T9 at the 2013 TOUR Championship by Coca-Cola). His previous starts at the Wells Fargo Championship led to T32 (2012) and T65 (2013) finishes...Played in the Web.com Tour Finals in an attempt to regain exempt TOUR status. Made the cut in the first Finals' event, the Hotel Fitness Championship (T41)...Followed it with a T10 at the second event, the Chiquita Classic, carding 72-67-67-71 and picking up a check for $26,000, to get in the middle of the battle for a TOUR card...A T60 at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship left him 41st on the priority ranking with one Finals event to play. Would finish T40 at the Web.com Tour Championship, which dropped him one outside the number, at No. 51. Only $31.66 separated him and No. 50 Eric Axley.

2013: Sophomore season on the PGA TOUR included a 21st-place finish in the FedExCup. Season included 19 made cuts (equaling his total from 2012) in 29 starts, with a runner-up finish at the AT&T National the best of his four top-10 finishes...Posted a final-round 69 at the AT&T National, three shots behind Bill Haas. Led after the first round and held a share of the third-round lead. It was his first third-round lead on TOUR. Previous-best TOUR finish was a T7 at the 2012 Greenbrier Classic...In July, posted four sub-par rounds at Glen Abbey GC to claim a T6 with John Merrick and Mark Wilson at the RBC Canadian Open...Recorded his 11th top-25 finish in his 17th made cut of the season, finishing T9 at the Deutsche Bank Championship. Carded rounds of 65-65-68-71 to finish seven strokes behind Henrik Stenson, moving from No. 34 to No. 25 in the FedExCup standings...The former Georgia Tech standout advanced to the TOUR Championship by Coca-Cola in Atlanta, Ga. for the first time, closing with a 5-under 65 for a T9 (his fourth top-10 finish of the year) at East Lake. 

2012: A second-round, 6-under 64 and a final-round, 7-under 63 led to a T7 at The Greenbrier Classic, topping his previous career-best finish (T14 at the Puerto Rico Open)...Entered the Playoffs ranked No. 100 in the FedExCup standings. Finished T24 at The Barclays to move to No. 80, but a T51 at the Deutsche Bank Championship wasn't good enough to advance to the BMW Championship field, finishing the season No. 77 in the FedExCup. 

2011: Did not make any PGA TOUR starts but did finish T13 at the PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament...Made 25 Web.com Tour starts, where he claimed four top-10 finishes and finished No. 23 on the official money list...Earned his first top-10 of the year, with a T4 at the BMW Charity Pro-Am, where he closed with a 6-under 65 on the final day at Thornblade Club. Opened his round with an eagle-2 on the first hole and followed up with consecutive birdies, eventually turning the front side in 5-under 30...Missed the next three cuts before notching another T4 finish, at the Mexico Open. Entered Sunday tied for 21st but opened the final round, front-nine 6-under 30 then added three more birdies on Nos. 10-12 to climb to 9-under par through 12 holes before settling for a 7-under 65...Was T8 in his next start, the Chiquita Classic, where he posted an 8-under 64 in the third round...Added another T8 a month later at the Midwest Classic in Kansas City. 

2010: He played in 12 Web.com Tour events and made eight cuts. His best performance came at the Preferred Health Systems Wichita Open where he came in second, falling by a stroke to Jhonattan Vegas in Kansas. Finished No. 62 on the money list. 

2009: Made his Web.com Tour debut at the South Georgia Classic in his home state. Missed the cut...Won twice on the eGolf Professional Tour, but returned to the Web.com Tour late in the season. Enjoyed a career-best T6 performance at the Chattanooga Classic...Played the following week at the Miccosukee Championship in Miami and T12. 

2008: Made his career PGA TOUR start, at the AT&T Classic, where he missed the cut. It was his only start of the year. 

2007: After turning pro, won his first professional tournament, in Virginia on the eGolf Professional Tour. Has won five times on that Tour. Also played on the Hooters Tour.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Capped a stellar college career at Georgia Tech by earning All-American honors and receiving the 2007 Byron Nelson Award. Had 30 top-20 finishes in his 47 college stroke-play tournaments...Was a two-time member of the U.S. Palmer Cup team.
tourBios.personal: Lists Randy Brooks, Danny Elkins and Jeff Paton as instructors...Has won five times on the eGolf Professional Tour and played on the Hooters Tour...Favorite course he's played is Pebble Beach and would like to play Merion...Favorite college team is Georgia Tech and pro team is the Atlanta Falcons...Favorite TV show is "Treme" and "There Will be Blood" is his favorite movie. Favorite food is chocolate. Favorite athletes to watch are Tiger Woods and Roger Federer. Favorite cities to visit are New York, Prague and San Francisco...Would round out his dream foursome with Bobby Jones, Woods and John Lennon...Not many people know that he contributes to the website allthingsthataregood.com...Bucket list includes living in New York City...Is the nephew of former LPGA player Jenny Lidback...Brother, Franco, was a two-time all-conference member of the University of North Carolina-Charlotte after transferring from LSU.

tourBios.exmtStatus: 10th on the 2015 Web.com Tour priority list
tourBios.curYearHigh: Finished T4 at the Sanderson Farms Championship after holding the first- and second-round leads, highlighted by a course-record 10-under 62 at the CC of Jackson. Held a four-shot lead after 36 holes before a lengthy weather delay resulted in a Monday finish.
tourBios.carHigh:
2014-15: Playing on the PGA TOUR for the fourth consecutive season, failed to advance to the Playoffs for the second year in a row, finishing No. 188 in the FedExCup standings. Season included 11 made cuts in 16 starts, with a T23 at the Barbasol Championship his lone top-25 finish...In the Web.com Tour Finals, made the cut in all four events, posting a T9 in the Small Business Connection Championship at River Run and a T2 at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship, where he led by two entering the final day following rounds of 70-68-68 at the difficult Ohio State University Scarlet Course. A 4-over-par 75 Sunday, that included a 3-over 38 on the incoming nine, doomed his chance at victory. Would finish two back of winner Andrew Loupe...At the Web.com Tour Championship, was T56 after consecutive rounds of 70. Fired a course-record-tying 62 Sunday, which moved him to a T10. Was the second time he'd tied a course record at TPC Sawgrass, having fired a 63 on the Stadium Course in the 2013 PLAYERS. Was 10th in the final priority-ranking order.

2013-14: Made the cut in 11 of 27 PGA TOUR starts, collecting five top-25 finishes and finishing No. 135 in the FedExCup standings. Enjoyed a career-best T6 performance at the Chattanooga Classic...Played the following week at the Miccosukee Championship in Miami and T12.

2007: After turning pro, won his first professional tournament, in Virginia on the eGolf Professional Tour. Has won five times on that Tour. Also played on the Hooters Tour. 

Amateur: Capped a stellar college career at Georgia Tech by earning All-American honors and receiving the 2007 Byron Nelson Award. Overall, was a four-time All-American and two-time Academic All-American while at Georgia Tech. Had 30 top-20 finishes in his 47 college stroke-play tournaments...Was a two-time member of the U.S. Palmer Cup team.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR in 2016 is T4th at the Sanderson Farms Championship.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T39th in Scoring Average (Actual) on the PGA TOUR.
